feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 3:51PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...TWO WINTER STORMS EXPECTED TO IMPACT SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGHOUT THE WEEK.... The active weather pattern will continue as the new work week progresses. The first system is expected to move through Southcentral Monday afternoon through Tuesday. Expect precipitation in the form of snow for all areas with snow
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Matanuska Valley; Northeast Prince William Sound; Southeast Prince William Sound; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 13 at 2:43PM AKST until February 14 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills 60 to 70 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Now to 6 PM Monday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 2:41PM AKST until February 13 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow occuring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Expect an additional 1 to 2 inches of snow through tonight. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range south of Trims Camp.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 2:41PM AKST until February 14 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch expected. Visibility one half mile or less at times.

entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 1:44PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Brief Return to Winter Monday Evening into Tuesday Morning... A fast moving slider-type low pressure system will move across eastern California and western Nevada Monday evening into early Tuesday morning. This will bring an increase in winds Monday afternoon into Monday night, with colder conditions and a short period of rain and snow Monday evening through early Tuesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 9:06PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: Light snow will continue to fall this evening with an additional light coating of snow. With temperatures in mid 20s, slippery conditions will be possible on all untreated surfaces. If traveling this evening, exercise extra caution on the roads.
